data.profileText: a Representative from Massachusetts; born in Nantucket, Mass., June 12, 1765; attended the public schools; studied law; admitted to the bar and practiced; member of the Massachusetts state senate 1809-1815 and in 1822; elected as a Democratic Republican to the Fifteenth Congress and reelected to the Sixteenth Congress (March 4, 1817-March 3, 1821); resumed the practice of law; died in Nantucket, Mass., September 8, 1849; interment in Friends Burying Ground.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: [Folger, William Coleman]. Memoir of the late Hon. Walter Folger. New Bedford: Fessenden & Baker, printers, 1874.

Gardner, William Edward. The Clock That Talks and What It Tells; A Portrait Story of the Maker: Hon. Walter Folger, Jr., Astronomer, Mathematician, Navigator, Lawyer, Judge, Legislator, Congressman, Philosopher, But He Called Himself: Clock and Watchmaker. [Nantucket]: Whaling Museum Publications; Distributed by the Personal Book Shop, Boston, [1954].

researchRecord.name: 1808-1847, 1 volume.
researchRecord.description: The Walter Folger records document repair work on clocks, watches, compasses, and other items and fittings for ships (p. 1-31); ledger (1808-1828, 1841-1847); and miscellaneous accounts (1842-1846).

researchRecord.name: In the Folger Family Papers, 1676-1952, 3.5 linear feet.
In the Folger-Macy Papers/Paine collection, 1765-1905, 2.5 inches.
In the Margaret Wyer Papers, 1761-1913, 1 envelope.
